entry.title: On the stability of dual scattering channel schemes
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by arXiv administrators. It is an erroneous duplicate submission of math.NA/0405095.

entry.title: Lower bounds for some decision problems over C
entry.summary: Lower bounds for some explicit decision problems over the complex numbers are given.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Theoretical Computer Science, Volume 276, Issues 1-2, 6 April 2002, Pages 425-434.

entry.title: Peano-like bounds for some Newton-Cotes formulae
entry.summary: An error analysis for some Newton-Cotes quadrature formulae is presented. Peano-like error bounds are obtained. They are generally, but not always, better than the usual Peano bounds.

entry.title: Iterative solution of linear equations with unbounded operators
entry.summary: A convergent iterative process is constructed for solving any solvable linear equation in a Hilbert space.

entry.title: A new and elementary proof of Newton's "favorite" quadrature formulae
entry.summary: In this note we shall give a new proof to a quadrature formulae due to Newton.

entry.title: The Bramble-Hilbert Lemma
entry.summary: This is an introductory document surveying several results in polynomial approximation, known as the Bramble-Hilbert lemma.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, no figures; added 1D case for exposition

entry.title: An Improved Error Bound for Multiquadric and Inverse Multiquadric Interpolation
entry.summary: A new error bound which is better than the current exponential-type error bound is presented in this paper.

entry.title: An Improved Error Bound for Gaussian Interpolation
entry.summary: An error bound for Gaussian Interpolation which is better than the current exponential-type error bound is presented.

entry.title: The Problem with the Linpack Benchmark Matrix Generator
entry.summary: We characterize the matrix sizes for which the Linpack Benchmark matrix generator constructs a matrix with identical columns.

entry.title: Manifold approximation of set-valued functions
entry.summary: A new continuity for set-valued functions is introduced, and an existence theorem is proved for such continuous set-valued functions.

entry.title: Continuous limits of discrete perimeters
entry.summary: We consider a class of discrete convex functionals which satisfy a (generalized) coarea formula, and study their limit in the continuum.

entry.title: New approach of Dbar method for discontinuous conductivity
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: On Greedy Algorithms with bounded cumulative coherence
entry.summary: We discuss the upper and lower estimates for the rate of convergence of Pure and Orthogonal Greedy Algorithms for dictionary with bounded cumulative coherence.

entry.title: On the optimality of Orthogonal Greedy Algorithm for M-coherent dictionaries
entry.summary: We show that Orthogonal Greedy Algorithms (Orthogonal Matching Pursuit) provides almost optimal approximation on the first [1/(20M)] steps for M-coherent dictionaries

entry.title: The Mystery of the Shape Parameter IV
entry.summary: In this paper we present a set of criteria for the choice of the shape parameter c contained in multiquadrics.

entry.title: Evenly Spaced Data Points and Radial Basis Functions
entry.summary: This article explores the influence of evenly spaced data points on radial-basis-function interpolation.

entry.title: Approximation of Urison operator with operator polynomials of Stancu type
entry.summary: Positive polynomial operator that approximates Urison operator, when integration domain is a "regular triangle" is investigated. We obtain Bernstein Polynomials as a particular case.

entry.title: A note of pointwise estimates on Shishkin meshes
entry.summary: We propose the estimates of the discrete Green function for the stream- line diffusion finite element method (SDFEM) on Shishkin meshes.

entry.title: The Centroid Method for Imaging through Turbulence
entry.summary: A simple and effective method for imaging through ground-level atmospheric turbulence.

entry.title: A fast Fourier transform method for computing the weight enumerator polynomial and trigonometric degree of lattice rules
entry.summary: A fast Fourier transform method for computing the weight enumerator polynomial and trigonometric degree of lattice rules is introduced.

entry.title: Galerkin method for linear Integral-Algebraic Equations of index 1
entry.summary: In this paper, we study direct and indirect Galerkin method for solving linear Integral-Algebraic Equations of index 1. Convergence of indirect method is also analyzed.

entry.title: Preserving first integrals with symmetric Lie group methods
entry.summary: The discrete gradient approach is generalized to yield integral preserving methods for differential equations in Lie groups.

entry.title: Five lectures on DPG methods
entry.summary: This is a set of lecture notes introducing graduate students to the topic of Discontinuous Petrov-Galerkin (DPG) methods.

entry.title: Stable numerical coupling of exterior and interior problems for the wave equation
entry.summary: Stable numerical coupling of exterior and interior problems for the wave equation

entry.title: On some inequalities of Chebyshev type
entry.summary: We obtain some new inequalities of Chebyshev Type.

entry.title: Average mixed volume under projection
entry.summary: The average mixed volume of a random projection of $d$ convex bodies in $\mathbb R^n$ is bounded above in terms of a quermassintegral.

entry.title: Note on the covering theorem for complex polynomials
entry.summary: In this note we give the answer to the question posed by V. N. Dubinin concerning covering properties of complex polynomials

entry.title: A note on the Joint Spectral Radius
entry.summary: A brief summary on the properties of the so called Joint Spectral Radius

entry.title: Bilinear characterizations of companion matrices
entry.summary: Companion matrices of the second type are characterized by properties that involve bilinear maps.

entry.title: A converse to Fortin's Lemma in Banach spaces
entry.summary: The converse of Fortin's Lemma in Banach spaces is established in this Note.

entry.title: Complementary results for the spectral analysis of matrices in Galerkin methods with GB-splines
entry.summary: We collect some new results relative to the study of the spectral analysis of matrices in Galerkin methods based on generalized B-splines with high smoothness.

entry.title: The Scott-Vogelius finite elements revisited
entry.summary: We prove that the Scott-Vogelius finite elements are inf-sup stable on shape-regular meshes for piecewise quartic velocity fields and higher ($k \ge 4$).

entry.title: Cubatures on Grassmannians: moments, dimension reduction, and related topics
entry.summary: We briefly explain the use of cubature points on Grassmannians in numerical analysis.

entry.title: On Computation of Matrix Mittag-Leffler Function
entry.summary: A method for computation of the matrix Mittag-Leffler function is presented. The method is based on Jordan canonical form and implemented as a Matlab routine.

entry.title: Generalized relaxation of string averaging operators based on strictly relaxed cutter operators
entry.summary: Analysis of a generalized relaxation of string averaging operators
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Published in Journal of Nonlinear and Convex Analysis, Vol. 18, Iss. 3, 2017

entry.title: Sparse Recovery with Oversampling Ratio Greater than One Half
entry.summary: Solving sparse recovery problem with high oversampling ratio is hard. We show that it is theoretically possible and we propose two modified HTP algorithms with such performances.

entry.title: On the global error committed when evaluating the Evans function numerically
entry.summary: The Evans function is a tool for assessing the stability of travelling wave solutions for partial differential equations. A recent paper (math.NA/0605581) analyzes the order reduction experienced when evaluating the Evans function numerically. The details of some lengthy calculations were excluded from that paper for clarity. The purpose of this technical report is to make these details publicly available. The report is not intended to be read on its own; the reader is referred to math.NA/0605581 for background and references.

entry.title: Perspectives on information-based complexity
entry.summary: The authors discuss information-based complexity theory, which is a model of finite-precision computations with real numbers, and its applications to numerical analysis.

entry.title: An efficient step size selection for ODE codes
entry.summary: We give an algorithm for efficient step size control in numerical integration of non-stiff initial value problems, based on a formula tailormade to methods where the numerical solution is compared with a solution of lower order.

entry.title: Pseudo-Newton method for nonlinear equations
entry.summary: In order to avoid the evaluation of the Jacobian matrix and its inverse, the present author recently introduced the pseudo-Jacobian matrix with a general applicability of any nonlinear systems of equations. By using this concept, this paper proposes the pseudo-Newton method
entry.arxiv:comment: Welcome any comments to chenw@homer.shinshu-u.ac.jp or chenwwhy@hotmail.com

entry.title: Antisymmetry, pseudospectral methods, and conservative PDEs
entry.summary: `Dual composition', a new method of constructing energy-preserving discretizations of conservative PDEs, is introduced. It extends the summation-by-parts approach to arbitrary differential operators and conserved quantities. Links to pseudospectral, Galerkin, antialiasing, and Hamiltonian methods are discussed.

entry.title: A new definition of nonlinear statistics mean and variance
entry.summary: This note presents a new definition of nonlinear statistics mean and variance to simplify the nonlinear statistics computations. These concepts aim to provide a theoretical explanation of a novel nonlinear weighted residual methodology presented recently by the present author.
entry.arxiv:comment: Welcome any comments to chenw@homer.shinshu-u.ac.jp or chenwwhy@hotmail.com

entry.title: A Note on Regularized Shannon's Sampling Formulae
entry.summary: Error estimation is given for a regularized Shannon's sampling formulae, which was found to be accurate and robust for numerically solving partial differential equations.

entry.title: Uniformly Generating Distribution Functions for Discrete Random Variables
entry.summary: An algorithm is presented which, with optimal efficiency, solves the problem of uniform random generation of distribution functions for an n-valued random variable.

entry.title: Eigenfunctions on a Stadium Associated with Avoided Crossings of Energy Levels
entry.summary: The authors examine graphical properties of eigenfunctions with stadium boundaries associated with avoided crossings of energy levels.

entry.title: On the solutions of deformed algebraic systems
entry.summary: A problem concerning the shift of roots of a system of homogeneous algebraic equations is investigated. Its conservation and decomposition of a multiple root into simple roots are discussed.

entry.title: Polynomial Interpolation and a Multivariate Analog of Fundamental Theorem of Algebra
entry.summary: Starting with univariate polynomial interpolation we arrive to a natural generalization of fundamental theorem of algebra for certain systems of multivariate algebraic equations.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Symposium on Trends in Approximation Theory, Nashville, USA, (2000) Abstracts

entry.title: Alternative Orthogonal Polynomials
entry.summary: The double-direction orthogonalization algorithm is applied to construct sequences of polynomials, which are orthogonal over the interval [0,1]with the weighting function 1. Functional and recurrent relations are derived for the sequences that are the result of the inverse orthogonalization procedure. Quadratures, generated by the sequences are described.

entry.title: A new discrepancy principle
entry.summary: The aim of this note is to prove a new discrepancy principle. The advantage of the new discrepancy principle compared with the known one consists of solving a minimization problem approximately, rather than exactly, and in the proof of a stability result.

entry.title: Numerical Method for Solving Obstacle Scattering Problems by an Algorithm Based on the Modified Rayleigh Conjecture
entry.summary: A numerical algorithm is presented for solving the direct scattering problems by the Modified Rayleigh Conjecture Method (MRC) introduced by A.G.Ramm. Some numerical examples are given. They show that the method is numerically efficient.

entry.title: Asymptotic analysis of spatially inhomogeneous stiff and ultra-stiff cosmologies
entry.summary: This article has been removed. It has been superseded by gr-qc/0506097.
entry.arxiv:comment: Reworked and reposted as gr-qc/0506097. Accepted by CQG

entry.title: Univariate spline quasi-interpolants and applications to numerical analysis
entry.summary: We describe some new univariate spline quasi-interpolants on uniform partitions of bounded intervals. Then we give some applications to numerical analysis: integration, differentiation and approximation of zeros.

entry.title: Finding discontinuities of piecewise-smooth functions
entry.summary: Formulas for stable differentiation of piecewise-smooth functions are given. The data are noisy values of these functions. The locations of discontinuity points and the sizes of the jumps across these points are not assumed known, but found stably from the noisy data.

entry.title: On Wu and Schaback's Error Bound
entry.summary: In this paper we point out that the commonly used error bound in the theory of radial basis functions contains an important error. It doesn't apply for derivatives. Thus one should be very careful when dealing with differential equations.

entry.title: Optimal Approximation of Elliptic Problems by Linear and Nonlinear Mappings I
entry.summary: We study the optimal approximation of the solution of an operator equation Au=f by linear and nonlinear mappings.

entry.title: A matrix and its inverse: revisting minimal rank completions
entry.summary: We revisit a formula that connects the minimal ranks of triangular parts of a matrix and its inverse and relate the result to structured rank matrices. We also address the generic minimal rank problem.

entry.title: An orbit-preserving discretization of the classical Kepler problem
entry.summary: We present a remarkable discretization of the classical Kepler problem which preserves its trajectories and all integrals of motion. The points of any discrete orbit belong to an appropriate continuous trajectory.

entry.title: Some Refinements of Discrete Jensen's Inequality and Some of Its Applications
entry.summary: In this paper, using some aspects of convex functions, we refine discrete Jensen's inequality via weight functions. Then, using these results, we give some applications in different abstract spaces and obtain some new interesting inequalities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 Pages, submitted to Nonlinear Functional Analysis and Applications(NFAA)

entry.title: A priori estimates of smoothness of solutions to difference Bellman equations with linear and quasilinear operators
entry.summary: A priori estimates for finite-difference approximations for the first and second order derivatives are obtained for solutions of parabolic equations described in the title.

entry.title: Lie group computation of finite difference schemes
entry.summary: A Mathematica based program has been elaborated in order to determine the symmetry group of a finite difference equation, by means of its differential representation. The package provides functions which enable us to solve the determining equations of the related Lie group

entry.title: Correction of Errors in the First-Order Perturbation Expansions of Singular Vectors
entry.summary: This note corrects some serious errors in the first-order perturbation analysis of singular vectors as published by G.W. Stewart in his book "Matrix Algorithms Volume II: Eigensystems", SIAM, 2001.

entry.title: A New Error Bound for Shifted Surface Spline Interpolation
entry.summary: A New Error Bound for shifted surface spline interpolation is presented. This error bound probably is the most powerful one up to now.

entry.title: First derivatives estimates for finite-difference schemes
entry.summary: We give sufficient conditions under which solutions of discretized in space second-order parabolic and elliptic equations, perhaps degenerate, admit estimates of the first derivatives in the space variables independent of the mesh size.

entry.title: The cycle-convergence of restarted GMRES for normal matrices is sublinear
entry.summary: We prove that the cycle-convergence of the restarted GMRES applied to a system of linear equations with a normal coefficient matrix is sublinear.

entry.title: Calculation of the Norm of the Error Functional of Optimal Quadrature Formulas in the Space $W_2^{(2,1)}(0,1)$
entry.summary: In this paper in the space $W_2^{(2,1)}(0,1)$ square of the norm of the error functional of a optimal quadrature formula is calculated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, This paper was published in Uzbek Mathematical Journal, 2007, \No3

entry.title: The Inverse of a Nearly Banded Matrix
entry.summary: A quantitative form of the Nullity Theorem is presented, which establishes a linear relation between the singular values of the two submatrices involved in the theorem up to the first order. The theorem is then extended to function spaces and a corresponding form in infinite dimension is discussed.

entry.title: Average-Case Perturbations and Smooth Condition Numbers
entry.summary: We define a new condition number adapted to directionally uniform perturbations. The definitions and theorems can be applied to a large class of problems. We show the relation with the classical condition number, and study some interesting examples.

entry.title: A numerical algorithm for zero counting II: Randomization and Condition
entry.summary: This paper was witdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Open letter on "Adaptivity and computational complexity in the numerical solution of ODEs" by Silvana Ilie, Gustaf Soederlind and Robert M. Corless
entry.summary: This is an open letter that we sent to S. Ilie, G. Soederlind and R.M. Corless in August 2008.

entry.title: The Discrete Analogue of the Operator $d^{2m}/dx^{2m}$ and its Properties
entry.summary: In this paper the discrete analogue $D_m[\beta]$ of the differential operator $d^{2m}/dx^{2m}$ is constructed and its some new properties are proved.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper was published in the journal "Questions of Computational and Applied Mathematics". - Tashkent, 1985

entry.title: The Mystery of the Shape Parameter
entry.summary: In this paper we present criteria for the optimal choice of the shape parameter c contained in the famous radial function multiquadrics.

entry.title: The Mystery of the Shape Parameter II
entry.summary: In this paper we present criteria for the choice of the shape parameter c contained in the famous radial function multiquadric. It may be of interest to RBF people and all people using radial basis functions to do approximation.

entry.title: Two stable modifications of the finite section method
entry.summary: In this article we demonstrate and compare two modified versions of the classical finite section method for band-dominated operators in case the latter is not stable. For both methods we give explicit criteria for their applicability.

entry.title: Adaptive optimal regularization of the linear ill posed integral equations
entry.summary: We construct an adaptive asymptotically optimal in order in the $ L(2) $ sense a solution (estimation) of an integral linear equation of a first kind and energy of this solution with the confidence region building, also adaptive.

entry.title: The Mystery of the Shape Parameter III
entry.summary: In this paper we present a set of criteria for the choice of the shape parameter c contained in multiquadrics.

entry.title: Recursive Numerical Evaluation of the Cumulative Bivariate Normal Distribution
entry.summary: We propose an algorithm for evaluation of the cumulative bivariate normal distribution, building upon Marsaglia's ideas for evaluation of the cumulative univariate normal distribution. The algorithm is mathematically transparent, delivers competitive performance and can easily be extended to arbitrary precision.

entry.title: Polyharmonic Daubechies type wavelets in Image Processing and Astronomy, I
entry.summary: We introduce a new family of multivariate wavelets which are obtained by "polyharmonic subdivision". They generalize directly the original compactly supported Daubechies wavelets.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, prepared for the ACM proceedings of CompSysTech 2010

entry.title: The Shape Parameter in the Gaussian Function
entry.summary: In this paper we explore the influence of the shape parameter in the gaussian function on error estimates and present a set of criteria for its optimal choice.

entry.title: Numerical comparisons among some methods for Hamiltonian problems
entry.summary: We report a few sumerical tests comparing some newly defined energy-preserving integrators and symplectic methods, using either constant and variable stepsize.

entry.title: Inexact Newton regularization methods in Hilbert scales
entry.summary: We consider a class of inexact Newton regularization methods for solving nonlinear inverse problems in Hilbert scales. Under certain conditions we obtain the order optimal convergence rate result.

entry.title: Imagerie laser
entry.summary: We derive an original direct imaging method of an object. It is based on topological derivatives, and aims at inverting the amplitude of waves that are retropropagated after laser illuminations.

entry.title: Dual Raviart-Thomas mixed finite elements
entry.summary: For an elliptic problem with two space dimensions, we propose to formulate the finite volume method with the help of Petrov-Galerkin mixed finite elementsthat are based on the building of a dual Raviart-Thomas basis.

entry.title: Petrov-Galerkin Finite Volumes
entry.summary: For an elliptic problem with two space dimensions, we propose to formulate the finite volume method with the help of Petrov-Galerkin mixed finite elementsthat are based on the building of a dual Raviart-Thomas basis.

entry.title: Computing material fronts with a Lagrange-Projection approach
entry.summary: This paper reports investigations on the computation of material fronts in multi-fluid models using a Lagrange-Projection approach. Various forms of the Projection step are considered. Particular attention is paid to minimization of conservation errors.

entry.title: A simple way to speedup Gauss Elimination
entry.summary: This article looks at a simple modification to speedup the conventional Gauss Elimination. The proposed modification speeds up the conventional Gauss Elimination by a factor of nearly 9/7 (in the asymptotic limit).

entry.title: Geometric Integration of Non-autonomous Systems with Application to Rotor Dynamics
entry.summary: Geometric integration of non-autonomous classical engineering problems, such as rotor dynamics, is investigated. It is shown, both numerically and by backward error analysis, that geometric (structure preserving) integration algorithms are superior to conventional Runge-Kutta methods.

entry.title: An Inversion Algorithm for Cyclic Nonadiagonal Matrix
entry.summary: In this paper, we compose a computational algorithm for the determinant and the inverse of the n x n cyclic nonadiagonal matrix. The algorithm is suited for implementation using computer algebra systems (CAS) such as Mathematica and Maple.

entry.title: An approximation of Daubechies wavelet matrices by perfect reconstruction filter banks with rational coefficients
entry.summary: It is described how the coefficients of Daubechies wavelet matrices can be approximated by rational numbers in such a way that the perfect reconstruction property of the filter bank be preserved exactly

entry.title: Another proof of Pell identities by using the determinant of tridiagonal matrix
entry.summary: In this paper, another proof of Pell identities is presented by using the determinant of tridiagonal matrices. It is calculated via the Laplace expansion.

entry.title: Energy estimates for Galerkin semidiscretizations of time domain boundary integral equations
entry.summary: In this paper we present a battery of results related to how Galerkin semidiscretization in space affects some formulations of wave scattering and propagation problems when retarded boundary integral equations are used.

entry.title: Numerical approximation of a linear elasticity model
entry.summary: We consider a nonlocal linear elastic wave model. We approximate the model using a spectral Galerkin method in space and analyze error in such an approximation. We perform some numerical experiments to demonstrate the scheme.

entry.title: On the Continuity of Multivariate Lagrange Interpolation at Chung-Yao Lattices
entry.summary: We give a natural geometric condition that ensures that sequences of Chung-Yao interpolation polynomials (of fixed degree) of sufficiently differentiable functions converge to a Taylor polynomial.

entry.title: A Proof of Convergence for Numerical Approximations Generated by the Locally Inertial Godunov Method in General Relativity
entry.summary: We provide details for the proof of convergence of the locally inertial Godunov method with dynamical time dilation.

entry.title: The generalized Newton--Kantorovich method for equations with nondifferentiable operators
entry.summary: The article deals with the generalized Newton--Kantorovich method for solving operator equations with nondifferentiable operators in Banach spaces. The convergence theorem is proved by means of majorant scalar equations.

entry.title: Filtre NAPES pour signaux bruit√©s
entry.summary: We extend the APES ({\sl Amplitude and Phase Estimation}) method of spectral analysis to the case of non-quasi periodic signals like appears in OFDM.

entry.title: Applications of nonvariational finite element methods to Monge--Amp√®re type equations
entry.summary: The goal of this work is to illustrate the application of the nonvariational finite element method to a specific Monge--Amp\`ere type nonlinear partial differential equation. The equation we consider is that of prescribed Gauss curvature.

entry.title: A Note on the Ladyzenskaja-Babuska-Brezzi Condition
entry.summary: The analysis of finite-element-like Galerkin discretization techniques for the stationary Stokes problem relies on the so-called LBB condition. In this work we discuss equivalent formulations of the LBB condition.

entry.title: Interpolants of Lattice Functions for the Analysis of Atomistic/Continuum Multiscale Methods
entry.summary: We introduce a general class of (quasi-)interpolants of functions defined on a Bravais lattice, and establish several technical results for these interpolants that are crucial ingredients in the analysis of atomistic models and atomistic/continuum multi-scale methods.

entry.title: Inner product quadratures
entry.summary: We introduce a n-term quadrature to integrate inner products of n functions, as opposed to a Gaussian quadrature to integrate 2n functions. We will characterize and provide computational tools to construct the inner product quadrature, and establish its connection to the Gaussian quadrature.

entry.title: Particle in Cell (PIC): Error Estimates for Adaptive Grids
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to rewritting and skipping crucial sign errors.

entry.title: Geometric Multiproducts: A New Extrapolation Tool
entry.summary: We show how to extrapolate an analytic function (or a smooth signal) by multiplying and dividing its values on geometric sequences that collapse to a point.

author.name: Patrick Arthur Miller
author.arxiv:affiliation: Graduate Center, City University of New York

entry.title: Kantorovich's Theorem on Newton's Method
entry.summary: In this work we present a simplifyed proof of Kantorovich's Theorem on Newton's Method. This analysis uses a technique which has already been used for obtaining new extensions of this theorem.

entry.title: On generalized discrete PML optimized for propagative and evanescent waves
entry.summary: We suggest a unified spectrally matched optimal grid approach for finite-difference and finite-element approximation of the PML. The new approach allows to combine optimal discrete absorption for both evanescent and propagative waves.

entry.title: On the norm of inverses of confluent Vandermonde matrices
entry.summary: In this note we present a simple upper bound for the row-wise norm of the inverses of general confluent Vandermonde matrices.

entry.title: An upper bound for the determinant of a diagonally balanced symmetric matrix
entry.summary: We prove a conjectured determinantal inequality: \frac{\det J}{\prod_{i=1}^nJ_{ii}}\le 2(1-\frac{1}{n-1})^{n-1}, where $J$ is a real $n\times n$ ($n\ge 2$) diagonally balanced symmetric matrix.

entry.title: Construction of discrete analogue of the differential operator $\frac{d^4}{dx^4}+2\frac{d^2}{dx^2}+1$ and its properties
entry.summary: In the present paper the discrete analogue of the differential operator $\frac{d^4}{dx^4}+2\frac{d^2}{dx^2}+1$ is constructed and its some properties are proved.
entry.arxiv:comment: The present work was published in Uzbek Math. Z. 2009, no 3

entry.title: LINE INTEGRAL METHODS and their application to the numerical solution of conservative problems
entry.summary: These are the lecture notes of a course given by the first author on December 27, 2012 - January 4, 2013, held at the Academy of Mathematics and Systems Science Chinese Academy of Sciences in Beijing.

entry.title: Minimal cubature rules on an unbounded domain
entry.summary: A family of minimal cubature rules is established on an unbounded domain, which is the first such family known on unbounded domains. The nodes of such cubature rules are common zeros of certain orthogonal polynomials on the unbounded domain, which are also constructed.

entry.title: Total wave based fast direct solver for volume scattering problems
entry.summary: We present a fast direct solver for the volume scattering problem of the Helmholtz equation. The algorithm is faster than existing methods. Moreover, discretization for our method is much simpler and more accurate than that for finite difference, finite elements, and integral equations.

entry.title: A Comparison Study of Two Methods for Elliptic Boundary Value Problems
entry.summary: In this paper, we perform a comparison study of two methods (the embedded boundary method and several versions of the mixed finite element method) to solve an elliptic boundary value problem.

entry.title: Computing the first eigenpair for problems with variable exponents
entry.summary: We compute the first eigenpair for variable exponent eigenvalue problems. We compare the homogeneous definition of first eigenvalue with previous nonhomogeneous notions in the literature. We highlight the symmetry breaking phenomena

entry.title: Decay properties for functions of matrices over $C^*$-algebras
entry.summary: We extend previous results on the exponential off-diagonal decay of the entries of analytic functions of banded and sparse matrices to the case where the matrix entries are elements of a $C^*$-algebra.

entry.title: A class of iterative methods for solving nonlinear equation with fourth-order convergence
entry.summary: In this paper we established a class of optimal fourth-order methods which is obtained by existing third-order method for solving nonlinear equations for simple roots by using weight functions. Some physical examples are given to illustrate the efficiency and performance of our method.

entry.title: Stepsize control for Newton's method in the presence of singularities
entry.summary: Singularities in the Jacobian matrix are an obstacle to Newton's method. We show that stepsize controls suggested by Deuflhard and Steinhoff can be used to detect and rapidly converge to such singularities.

entry.title: An Algorithm on Multivariate Interpolation for Cartesian Grid Complex Boundary Problems
entry.summary: We present a simple algorithm to select multivariate interpolation stencil with a Cartesian grid. We show its applicability by using this algorithm in the embedded boundary method for solving the elliptic interface problem.

entry.title: Error estimates in periodic homogenization with a non-homogeneous Dirichlet condition
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the homogenization problem with a non-homogeneous Dirichlet condition. Our aim is to give error estimates with boundary data in $H^{1/2}(\partial\Omega)$. The tools used are those of the unfolding method in periodic homogenization.

entry.title: Robust Pade approximants may have spurious poles
entry.summary: We show that robust Pade approximants may have spurious poles and may not converge pointwise

entry.title: Approximate solution of inverse boundary problem for the heat exchange problem by A.N. Tikhonov regularization method
entry.summary: In this paper the approximate solution of the heat exchange problem by A.N. Tikhonov regularization method is presented. The errror estimation of this approximate is obtained.

entry.title: Supporting GENP with Random Multipliers
entry.summary: We prove that standard Gaussian random multipliers are expected to stabilize numerically both Gaussian elimination with no pivoting and block Gaussian elimination. Our tests show similar results where we applied circulant random multipliers instead of Gaussian ones.

entry.title: Energy-Based Atomistic-to-Continuum Coupling Without Ghost Forces
entry.summary: We present a practical implementation of an energy-based atomistic-to-continuum (a/c) coupling scheme without ghost forces, and numerical tests evaluating its accuracy relative to other types of a/c coupling schemes.

entry.title: Regularized solution of a nonlinear problem in electromagnetic sounding
entry.summary: We propose a regularization method to solve a nonlinear ill-posed problem connected to inversion of data gathered by a ground conductivity meter.

entry.title: Integer powers of certain complex tridiagonal matrices and some complex factorizations
entry.summary: In this paper, we obtain a general expression for the entries of the r. (r is integer) power of a certain n-square complex tridiagonal matrix. In addition, we get the complex factorizations of Fibonacci polynomials, Fibonacci and Pell numbers.

entry.title: On bounds of matrix eigenvalues
entry.summary: In this paper, we give estimates for both upper and lower bounds of eigenvalues of a simple matrix. The estimates are shaper than the known results.

entry.title: Tractability of multivariate integration in hybrid function spaces
entry.summary: We consider tractability of integration in reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces which are a tensor product of a Walsh space and a Korobov space. The main result provides necessary and sufficient conditions for weak, polynomial and strong polynomial tractability.

entry.title: On "Upper error bounds for quadrature formulas on function classes" by K. K. Frolov
entry.summary: This is a tutorial paper that gives the complete proof of a result of Frolov [2] that shows the optimal order of convergence for numerical integration of functions with bounded mixed derivatives. The presentation follows Temlyakov [8], see also [7].

entry.title: Quadratic Mixed finite element approximations of the Monge-Ampere equation in 2D
entry.summary: We give error estimates for a mixed finite element approximation of the two-dimensional elliptic Monge-Ampere equation with the unknowns approximated by Lagrange finite elements of degree two. The variables in the formulation are the scalar variable and the Hessian matrix.

entry.title: Matched $G^k$-constructions yield $C^k$-continuous iso-geometric elements
entry.summary: The note shows how $G^k$ (geometrically continuous surface) constructions yield $C^k$ iso-geometric elements also at irregular quad mesh points where three or more than four elements come together.

entry.title: Convolution Quadrature for Wave Simulations
entry.summary: These notes build an introduction to Convolution Quadrature techniques applied to linear convolutions and convolution equations with a bias to problems related to wave propagation. The notes are self-contained and emphasize algorithmic aspects. They include introductory material on vector-valued distributions, convolution operators, and Dunford calculus.

entry.title: A simple Monte Carlo method for solving of Navier-Stokes Equations
entry.summary: We offer a simple Monte-Carlo method for solving of the multidimensional initial value and non-homogeneous problem for the Navier-Stokes Equations in whole space when the initial function and right hand side belong to the correspondent Sobolev-Lebesgue-Riesz space.

entry.title: Discrete Aleksandrov solutions of the Monge-Ampere equation
entry.summary: We give the first proof of convergence, in the classical sense, of a finite difference scheme to the Aleksandrov solution of the elliptic Monge-Ampere equation. Discrete analogues of the Aleksandrov theory of the Monge-Ampere equation are derived.

entry.title: New lower bound estimates for quadratures of bounded analytic functions
entry.summary: We give an improved lower bound for the error of any quadrature computing $\int_{-1}^1 f(x) d\alpha(x)$ of analytic functions bounded in the neighborhood of $[-1,1]$.

entry.title: On the integration of stochastic rigid body with geometric numerical schemes
entry.summary: In the present paper we investigate the performance of explicit splitting schemes and related techniques applied to a rigid body model subject to a stochastic torque and random perturbations in the inertia tensor. Results are discussed and compared with traditional solvers for such model.

entry.title: Average polynomial time for eigenvector computations
entry.summary: We describe two algorithms for the eigenvalue, eigenvector problem which, on input a Gaussian matrix with complex entries, finish with probability 1 and in average polynomial time.

entry.title: On the error analysis of stabilized finite element methods for the Stokes problem
entry.summary: For a family of stabilized mixed finite element methods for the Stokes equations a complete a priori and a posteriori error analysis is given.

entry.title: Discrete Korn's inequality for shells
entry.summary: We prove Korn's inequalities for Naghdi and Koiter shell models defined on spaces of discontinuous piecewise functions. They are useful in study of discontinuous finite element methods for shells.

entry.title: An explicit and positivity preserving numerical scheme for the mean reverting CEV model
entry.summary: In this paper we propose an explicit and positivity preserving scheme for the mean reverting CEV model which converges in the mean square sense with convergence order $a(a-1/2)$.

entry.title: Some remarks on strongly coupled systems of convection-diffusion equations in 2D
entry.summary: Almost nothing is known about the layer structure of solutions to strongly coupled systems of convection-diffusion equations in two dimensions. In some special cases we present first results.

entry.title: A note on algebraic Riccati equations associated with reducible singular M-matrices
entry.summary: We prove a conjecture about the minimal nonnegative solutions of algebraic Riccati equations associated with reducible singular M-matrices. The result enhances our understanding of the behaviour of doubling algorithms for finding the minimal nonnegative solutions.

entry.title: On the Chebyshev approximation of a function with two variables
entry.summary: There is presented an approach to find an approximation polynomial of a function with two variables based on the two dimensional discrete Fourier transform. The approximation polynomial is expressed through Chebyshev polynomials. There is given an uniform convergence result.

entry.title: Alternative Orthogonal Rational Functions on a Half Line
entry.summary: System of alternatively orthogonalized rational functions of Jacobi type on the half line $[1, \infty)$ is defined and its properties are established. Three subsystems of proper and mixed systems of rational functions with nice properties are presented.

entry.title: Algebraic structure of aromatic B-series
entry.summary: Aromatic B-series are a generalization of B-series. Some of the operations defined for B-series can be defined analogically for aromatic B-series. This paper derives combinatorial formulas for the composition and substitution laws for aromatic B-series.

entry.title: Rescaled Pure Greedy Algorithm for Hilbert and Banach Spaces
entry.summary: We show that a very simple modification of the Pure Greedy Algorithm for approximating functions by sparse sums from a dictionary in a Hilbert or more generally a Banach space has optimal convergence rates on the class of convex combinations of dictionary elements

entry.title: A note on impossibility of uniformly non-oscillatory approximation
entry.summary: In this note we show that it is impossible to have data independent non-oscillatory three point finite difference scheme irrespective of its accuracy for a scalar hyperbolic initial value problem.

entry.title: Approximation properties by generalized Baskakov Kantorovich Stancu type operators
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce generalized Baskakov Kantorovich Stancu type operators and investigate direct result, local approximation and weighted approximation properties of these operators. Modulus of continuity, second modulus of continuity, Peeters K-functional, weighted modulus of continuity and Lipschitz class are considered to prove our results.

entry.title: Fast orthogonal transforms for multi-level quasi-Monte Carlo integration
entry.summary: We combine a generic method for finding fast orthogonal transforms for a given quasi-Monte Carlo integration problem with the multilevel Monte Carlo method. It is shown by example that this combined method can vastly improve the efficiency of quasi-Monte Carlo.

entry.title: Voronovskaja type asymptotic approximation by general gamma type operators
entry.summary: In the present paper, we studied the voronovskaja type theorem for general Gamma type operators. Also, we obtain an error estimate for general Gamma type operators.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Journal of Mathematics And its Applications, Volume 3, Issue 4-B (2015), 71-78

entry.title: Discrete Green functions of the SDFEM on Shishkin triangular meshes
entry.summary: We propose estimates of the discrete Green function for the streamline diffusion finite element method (SDFEM) on Shishkin triangular meshes.

entry.title: On the Convergence of the Variational Iteration Method
entry.summary: Convergence results are stated for the variational iteration method applied to solve an initial value problem for a system of ordinary differential equations.

entry.title: An improved lower bound for the $L_2$-discrepancy
entry.summary: We give an improved lower bound for the $L_2$-discrepancy of finite point sets in the unit square.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, version 2: several minor changes incorporating referee's suggestions

entry.title: On the finite element approximation of infinity-harmonic functions
entry.summary: In this note we show that conforming Galerkin approximations for p-harmonic functions tend to infinity-harmonic functions in the limit p \to \infty and h \to 0, where h denotes the Galerkin discretisation parameter.

entry.title: Semicoercive Variational Inequalities - From Existence to Numerical Solution of Nonmonotone Contact Problems
entry.summary: In this paper we present a novel numerical solution procedure for semicoercive hemivariational inequalities. As a model example we consider a unilateral semicoercive contact problem with nonmonotone friction and provide numerical results for benchmark tests.

entry.title: On a conjecture in bivariate interpolation
entry.summary: The Gasca-Maeztu conjecture for the case $n=4$ was proved for the first time in [J. R. Busch, A note on Lagrange interpolation in $\mathbb{R}^2$, Rev. Un. Mat. Argentina, 36 (1990) 33--38]. Here we bring a short and simple proof of it.

entry.title: Splines in geometry and topology
entry.summary: This survey paper describes the role of splines in geometry and topology, emphasizing both similarities and differences from the classical treatment of splines. The exposition is non-technical and contains many examples, with references to more thorough treatments of the subject.

entry.title: The Heterogeneous Multiscale Finite Volume Method for Convection-Diffusion-Reaction Problem
entry.summary: In this paper, we employ an finite volume method (FVM) based on the heterogenous multiscale method (HMM), for the multiscale convection-diffusion-reaction problem. The optimal order convergence rate in H^1-norm is given for periodic medias.

entry.title: Simple finite element schemes for the solution of the curl-div system
entry.summary: New variational formulations are devised for the curl--div system, and the corresponding finite element approximations are shown to converge. Curl--free and divergence--free finite elements are employed for discretizing the problem.

entry.title: A Refinement Algorithm for Generalized B-splines
entry.summary: In this paper we present a method for knot insertion and degree elevation of generalized B-splines (GB-splines) via the local representation of these curves as piecewise functions. The use of local structures makes the refinement routines simpler to understand and implement.

entry.title: Virtual Element Method for fourth order problems: $L^2-$estimates
entry.summary: We analyse the family of $C^1$-Virtual Elements introduced in \cite{Brezzi:Marini:plates} for fourth-order problems and prove optimal estimates in $L^2$ and in $H^1$ via classical duality arguments.

entry.title: Prony's method in several variables
entry.summary: The paper gives an extension of Prony's method to the multivariate case which is based on the relationship between polynomial interpolation, normal forms modulo ideals and H--bases.

entry.title: Newton type method for nonlinear Fredholm integral equations
entry.summary: This paper present a numerical method for solving nonlinear Fredholm integral equations. The method is based upon Newton type approximations. Illustrative examples are included to demonstrate the validity and applicability of the technique.

entry.title: Eigenvalue bounds for matrix polynomials in generalized bases
entry.summary: We derive inclusion regions for the eigenvalues of matrix polynomials expressed in a general polynomial basis, which can lead to significantly better results than traditional bounds. We present several applications to engineering problems.

entry.title: Mixed and stabilized finite element methods for the obstacle problem
entry.summary: We discretize the Lagrange multiplier formulation of the obstacle problem by mixed and stabilized finite element methods. A priori and a posteriori error estimates are derived and numerically verified.

entry.title: An Extended Pruess Method for Sturm-Liouville Problems
entry.summary: A new version of the piecewise approximation (Pruess) method is developed for calculating eigenvalues of Sturm-Liouville problems. The usual piecewise constant or piecewise linear potential approximations are replaced by translates of $2/cos^2(x)$, whose corresponding eigenvalue equation has elementary solutions.

entry.title: The BCH-Formula and Order Conditions for Splitting Methods
entry.summary: As an application of the BCH-formula, order conditions for splitting schemes are derived. The same conditions can be obtained by using non-commutative power series techniques and inspecting the coefficients of Lyndon-Shirshov words.

entry.title: Material Optimization for Nonlinearly Elastic Planar Beams
entry.summary: We consider the problem of an optimal distribution of soft and hard material for nonlinearly elastic planar beams. We prove that under gravitational force the optimal distribution involves no microstructure and is ordered, and we provide numerical simulations confirming and extending this observation.

entry.title: A note on convergence analysis of NURBS curve when weights approach infinity
entry.summary: This article considers the convergence of NURBS curve when weights approach infinity. We shows that limit of NURBS curve dose not exist when independent variables weights approach infinity. Further, pointwise convergence uniform convergence and $L^1$ convergence are researched.

entry.title: Any admissible harmonic Ritz value set is possible for prescribed GMRES residual norms
entry.summary: We show that any admissible harmonic Ritz value set is possible for prescribed GMRES residual norms, which is a complement for the results in [Duintjer Tebbens and Meurant, {\it SIAM J. Matrix Anal. Appl.}, 33 (2012), no. 3, pp. 958--978].

entry.title: A Note On A Norm-Preserving Continuous Galerkin Time Stepping Scheme
entry.summary: In this note we shall devise a variable-order continuous Galerkin time stepping method which is especially geared towards norm-preserving dynamical systems. In addition, we will provide an a posteriori estimate for the $L^\infty$-error.

entry.title: Green's formulas and variational equations
entry.summary: In this paper, I give an extension to the banachic - non linear- case of the work of B. Hanouzet and J.L. Joly which is quoted below in the bibliography and which was elaborated in the hilbertian- linear- case.

entry.title: A note on alternating minimization algorithms: Bregman frame
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a Bregman frame for several classical alternating minimization algorithms. In the frame, these algorithms have uniform mathematical formulation. We also present convergence analysis for the frame algorithm. Under the Kurdyka-Lojasiewicz property, stronger convergence is obtained.

entry.title: The Minc-type bound and the eigenvalue inclusion sets of the general product of tensors
entry.summary: In this paper, we give the Minc-type bound for spectral radius of nonnegative tensors. We also present the bounds for the spectral radius and the eigenvalue inclusion sets of the general product of tensors.

entry.title: Full spectral testing of linear congruent method with a maximum period
entry.summary: In this paper the spectral analysis of all possible linear congruent sequences with a maximum period is conducted and the best random number generators are selected among them.

entry.title: Note on the best approximation in $L^1$ metric
entry.summary: We present one of the approaches to find the best approximation of the given function by trigonometric polynomials in $L^1$ metric and applied it to find the optimal constants in the Nikolsky's type inequality, concerning approximation of Lipschitz functions by algebraic polynomials.

entry.title: On the Numerical Solution of Nonlinear Fractional-Integro Differential Equations
entry.summary: In the present study, a numerical method, perturbation-iteration algorithm (shortly PIA), have been employed to give approximate solutions of nonlinear fractional-integro differential equations (FIDEs). Comparing with the exact solution, the PIA produces reliable and accurate results for FIDEs.

entry.title: Sovability of the mixed Formulation for Darcy-Forchheimer Flow in Porous Media
entry.summary: We consider the mixed formulation of the equations governing Darcy-Forchheimer flow in porous media. We prove existence and uniqueness of a solution for the stationary problem and the existence of a solution for the transient problem.

entry.title: b-Spline Curves and Surfaces as a Minimization of Quadratic Operators
entry.summary: The goal of this short note is to prove that every b-spline curve or surface (generated by uniform knots, without multiplicity) may be defined as minimum of positive quadratic operator.

entry.title: A Small Note About Lower Bound of Eigenvalues
entry.summary: This paper gives a framework to produce the lower bound of eigenvalues defined in a Hilbert space by the eigenvalues defined in another Hilbert space. The method is based on using the max-min principle for the eigenvalue problems.

entry.title: Truncated transparent boundary conditions
entry.summary: We derive equations for evaluating differential operators in transparent boundary conditions (TBCs) for a certain class of hyperbolic systems of second-order equations. This local part of TBCs can be used as approximate nonreflecting boundary conditions. We give examples of obtaining such truncated TBCs for 3D elasticity and Biot poroelasticity

entry.title: On a connection between layer-adapted exponentially graded and S-type meshes
entry.summary: In this short note we analyse a connection between the exponentially graded and the class of S-type meshes for singularly perturbed problems. As a by-product we obtain a slightly modified and more general class of layer-adapted meshes.

entry.title: Approximation by $C^1$ Splines on Piecewise Conic Domains
entry.summary: We develop a Hermite interpolation scheme and prove error bounds for $C^1$ bivariate piecewise polynomial spaces of Argyris type vanishing on the boundary of curved domains enclosed by piecewise conics.

entry.title: Optimal polynomial meshes and Caratheodory-Tchakaloff submeshes on the sphere
entry.summary: Using the notion of Dubiner distance, we give an elementary proof of the fact that good covering point configurations on the 2-sphere are optimal polynomial meshes. From these we extract Caratheodory-Tchakaloff (CATCH) submeshes for compressed Least Squares fitting.

entry.title: Two classes of quadratic vector fields for which the Kahan discretization is integrable
entry.summary: Applying Kahan's discretization to the reduced Nahm equations, we obtain two classes of integrable mappings.

entry.title: Perturbation analysis for the spectrum of an arbitrary matrix
entry.summary: In this paper, we present some new estimates for the spectrum of an arbitrary matrix after perturbation. One of our estimates improves the existing result established by Li and Chen [J. Comput. Math. 24 (2006) 141-148]. Several examples are given to illustrate the sharpness and effectiveness of our theoretical results.

entry.title: Convergence of the mac scheme for variable density flows
entry.summary: We prove in this paper the convergence of an semi-implicit MAC scheme for the time-dependent variable density Navier-Stokes equations.

entry.title: A Polynomial Spectral Calculus for Analysis of DG Spectral Element Methods
entry.summary: We introduce a polynomial spectral calculus that follows from the summation by parts property of the Legendre-Gauss-Lobatto quadrature. We use the calculus to simplify the analysis of two multidimensional discontinuous Galerkin spectral element approximations.

entry.title: On Remotest set and Random controls in Kaczmarz algorithm
entry.summary: In this paper we analyse the Kaczmarz projection algorithm with Remotest set and Random control of projection indices and provide a sufficient condition such that each projection index appears infinitely many times during the iterations.

entry.title: Estimations of the discrete Green's function of the SDFEM on Shishkin triangular meshes for problems with only exponential layers
entry.summary: In this technical report, we present estimations of the discrete Green's function of the streamline diffusion finite element method (SDFEM) on Shishkin triangular meshes for problems with only exponential layers.

entry.title: ESPIRIT for multidimensional general grids
entry.summary: We present a new method for complex frequency estimation in several variables, extending the classical (1d) ESPIRIT-algorithm. We also consider how to work with data sampled on non-standard domains (i.e going beyond multi-rectangles).

entry.title: The polynomial eigenvalue problem is well conditioned for random inputs
entry.summary: We compute the exact value of the squared condition number for the polynomial eigenvalue problem, when the input matrices have entries coming from the standard complex Gaussian distribution, showing that in general this problem is quite well conditioned.

entry.title: Optimal quadrature formulas for the Cauchy type singular integral in the Sobolev space $L_2^{(2)}(0,1)$
entry.summary: In the present paper in $L_2^{(2)}(0,1)$ S.L.Sobolev space the optimal quadrature formula is constructed for approximate calculation of Cauchy type singular integral.

entry.title: Error Estimation of Difference Operators on Irregular Nodes
entry.summary: Error estimation of difference operators on irregular nodes is discussed. We can obtain the similar estimates of the errors. However, the error estimate for the difference operators for the second derivatives becomes lower because of asymmetric allocation of the nodal points.

entry.title: Estimations of the discrete Green's function of the SDFEM on Shishkin triangular meshes for singularly perturbed problems with characteristic layers
entry.summary: In this technical report, we present estimations of the discrete Green's function of the streamline diffusion finite element method (SDFEM) on Shishkin triangular meshes for singularly perturbed problems with characteristic layers.

entry.title: Numerical approximation of multiple isolated roots of analytic systems
entry.summary: We propose a numerical analysis of a simplified version of the previous paper "Multiplicity hunting and approximating multiple roots of polynomial systems" written by the two authors.

entry.title: Numerical approximation of the best decay rate for some dissipative systems
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a numerical method to approximate the best decay rate for some dissipative systems. We give also some applications to illustrate it.

entry.title: Some Error Analysis on Virtual Element Methods
entry.summary: Some error analysis on virtual element methods including inverse inequalities, norm equivalence, and interpolation error estimates are presented for polygonal meshes which admits a virtual quasi-uniform triangulation.

entry.title: Finite Element Methods
entry.summary: These lecture notes for a graduate course present an introduction to the mathematical theory of finite element methods for the numerical solution of partial differential equations. Covered are conforming and nonconforming (in particular, discontinuous Galerkin and mixed methods) for elliptic partial differential equations and Galerkin methods for parabolic equations.

entry.title: The Finite difference method for the Minkowski Curve
entry.summary: In this work, we describe how to approximate solutions of some partial differential equations using the finite difference method defined on the Minkowski self-similar curve.

entry.title: Virtual Element Methods on Meshes with Small Edges or Faces
entry.summary: We consider a model Poisson problem in $\R^d$ ($d=2,3$) and establish error estimates for virtual element methods on polygonal or polyhedral meshes that can contain small edges ($d=2$) or small faces ($d=3$).

entry.title: A stable finite-difference scheme for growth and diffusion on a map
entry.summary: We describe a general Godunov type splitting for numerical simulations of the Fisher/Kolmogorov-Petrovski-Piskunov growth and diffusion equation in two spatial dimensions. In particular, the method is appropriate for modeling population growth and dispersal on a terrestrial map. The procedure is semi-implicit, hence quite stable, and approximately second order accurate, excluding boundary condition complications. It also has low memory requirements and shows good performance. We illustrate an application of this solver: global human dispersal in the late Pleistocene, modeled via growth and diffusion over geographical maps of paleovegetation and paleoclimate.

entry.title: Editors' remarks (on two complexity theory surveys in the Bulletin)
entry.summary: The authors discuss the role of controversy in mathematics as a preface to two opposing articles on computational complexity theory: "Some basic information on information-based complexity theory" by Beresford Parlett [math.NA/9201266] and "Perspectives on information-based complexity" by J. F. Traub and Henryk Wo\'zniakowski [math.NA/9201269].

entry.title: Integration and approximation of multivariate functions: average case complexity with isotropic Wiener measure
entry.summary: We study the average case complexity of multivariate integration and $L_2$ function approximation for the class $F=C([0,1]^d)$ of continuous functions of $d$ variables. The class $F$ is endowed with the isotropic Wiener measure (Brownian motion in Levy's sense). Furthermore, for both problems, only function values are used as data.

entry.title: Forced Lattice Vibrations -- A Videotext
entry.summary: We begin with a description of recent numerical and analytical results that are closely related to the results of this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is the textbook part of this work. The video with accompanying printed guide can be ordered from MSRI

entry.title: An accurate and efficient algorithm for the computation of the characteristic polynomial of a general square matrix
entry.summary: An algorithm is presented for the efficient and accurate computation of the coefficients of the characteristic polynomial of a general square matrix. The algorithm is especially suited for the evaluation of canonical traces in determinant quantum Monte-Carlo methods.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, no figures, to appear in J. Comp. phys

entry.title: Numerical integrators that contract volume
entry.summary: We study numerical integrators that contract phase space volume even when the ODE does so at an arbitrarily small rate. This is done by a splitting into two-dimensional contractive systems. We prove a sufficient condition for Runge-Kutta methods to have the appropriate contraction property for these two-dimensional systems; the midpoint rule is an example.

entry.title: Approximate Models of Dynamic Thermoviscoelasticity Describing Shape-Memory-Alloy Phase Transitions
entry.summary: We consider problems of dynamic viscoelasticity taking into account the coupling of elastic and thermal fields. Efficient approximate models are developed and computational results on thermomechanical behaviour of shape-memory-alloy structures are presented.

entry.title: Ultimate Polynomial Time
entry.summary: The class $\mathcal{UP}$ of `ultimate polynomial time' problems over $\mathbb C$ is introduced; it contains the class $\mathcal P$ of polynomial time problems over $\mathbb C$. The $\tau$-Conjecture for polynomials implies that $\mathcal{UP}$ does not contain the class of non-deterministic polynomial time problems definable without constants over $\mathbb C$. This latest statement implies that $\mathcal P \ne \mathcal{NP}$ over $\mathbb C$. A notion of `ultimate complexity' of a problem is suggested. It provides lower bounds for the complexity of structured problems.

entry.title: Polynomial Homotopies for Dense, Sparse and Determinantal Systems
entry.summary: Numerical homotopy continuation methods for three classes of polynomial systems are presented. For a generic instance of the class, every path leads to a solution and the homotopy is optimal. The counting of the roots mirrors the resolution of a generic system that is used to start up the deformations. Software and applications are discussed.

entry.title: A modified BFGS quasi-Newton iterative formula
entry.summary: The quasi-Newton equation is the very basis of a variety of the quasi-Newton methods. By using a relationship formula between nonlinear polynomial equations and the corresponding Jacobian matrix. presented recently by the present author, we established an exact alternative of the approximate quasi-Newton equation and consequently derived an modified BFGS updating formulas.
entry.arxiv:comment: Welcome any comments to chenw@homer.shinshu-u.ac.jp or chenwwhy@hotmail.com

entry.title: Optimal prediction and the Klein-Gordon equation
entry.summary: The method of optimal prediction is applied to calculate the future means of solutions to the Klein-Gordon equation. It is shown that in an appropriate probability space, the difference between the average of all solutions that satisfy certain constraints at time t=0, and the average computed by an approximate method, is small with high probability.

entry.title: Idempotent mathematics and interval analysis
entry.summary: A brief introduction into Idempotent Mathematics and an idempotent version of Interval Analysis are presented. Some applications are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, no figures; to be published in an abridged form in Reliable Computing (Kluwer); the bibliography is updated in this version

entry.title: Optimal Prediction of Stiff Oscillatory Mechanics
entry.summary: We consider many-body problems in classical mechanics where a wide range of time scales limits what can be computed. We apply the method of optimal prediction to obtain equations which are easier to solve numerically. We demonstrate by examples that optimal prediction can reduce the amount of computation needed to obtain a solution by several orders of magnitude.

entry.title: Conjugated filter approach for solving Burgers' equation with high Reynolds number
entry.summary: We propose a conjugated filter oscillation reduction scheme for solving Burgers' equation with high Reynolds numbers. Computational accuracy is tested at a moderately high Reynolds number for which analytical solution is available. Numerical results at extremely high Reynolds numbers indicate that the proposed scheme is efficient, robust and reliable for shock capturing.

entry.title: A unifying approach to software and hardware design for scientific calculations and idempotent mathematics
entry.summary: A unifying approach to software and hardware design generated by ideas of Idempotent Mathematics is discussed. The so-called idempotent correspondence principle for algorithms, programs and hardware units is described. A software project based on this approach is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, no figures; sibmitted to Reliable Computing; a substantially revised and enlarged version of quant-ph/9904024

entry.title: Approximate rational arithmetics and arbitrary precision computations
entry.summary: We describe an approximate rational arithmetic with round-off errors (both absolute and relative) controlled by the user. The rounding procedure is based on the continued fraction expansion of real numbers. Results of computer experiments are given in order to compare efficiency and accuracy of different types of approximate arithmetics and rounding procedures.

entry.title: Universal numerical algorithms and their software implementation
entry.summary: The concept of a universal algorithm is discussed. Examples of this kind of algorithms are presented. Software implementations of such algorithms in C++ type languages are discussed together with means that provide for computations with an arbitrary accuracy. Particular emphasis is placed on universal algorithms of linear algebra over semirings.

entry.title: A Generalization of Obreshkoff-Ehrlich Method for Multiple Roots of Algebraic, Trigonometric and Exponential Equations
entry.summary: In this paper methods for simultaneous finding all roots of generalized polynomials are developed. These methods are related to the case when the roots are multiple. They possess cubic rate of convergence and they are as labour-consuming as the known methods related to the case of polynomials with simple roots only.

entry.title: Some Generalizations of the Chebyshev Method for Simultaneous Determination of All Roots of Polynomial Equations
entry.summary: Iterative methods for the simultaneous determination of all roots of an equation are dis-cussed. The multiplicities of the roots are assumed to be known in advance. The methods are proved to have a cubical rate of convergence. Numerical examples are given.

entry.title: Double newtonisation of fixed point sequences
entry.summary: A neutral fixed point of a real iteration map $u$ becomes a super attracting fixed point using a suitable double newtonisation. The map $u$ is so transformed into a map $w$ which is here called the standard accelerator of $u$. The map $w$ provides a unifying process to deal with a large set of fixed point sequences which are not convergent or converge slowly. Several examples illustrate the main results obtained.

entry.title: Algorithm to generate ideals in a Lie algebra of matrices at any particular characteristic with Mathematica
entry.summary: We present in this paper a routine which construct the ideal generated by a list of elements in a matrix Lie algebra at any particular characteristic. We have used this algorithm to analyze the problem of the simplicity of some Lie algebras.

entry.title: Algorithm to compute the rank and a Cartan subalgebra of a matrix Lie algebra with Mathematica
entry.summary: We present in this paper a set of routines constructed to compute the rank of a matrix Lie algebra and also to determine a Cartan subalgebra from a given list of elements

entry.title: The Lie algebra splitg2 with Mathematica using Zorn's matrices
entry.summary: We will obtain in this paper a generic expression of any element in athe Lie algebra of the derivations of the split octonions a over an arbitrary field. For this purpose, we will use the Zorn's matrices. We will also compute the multiplication table of this Lie algebra.

entry.title: Newton Method on Riemannian Manifolds: Covariant Alpha-Theory
entry.summary: In this paper we study quantitative aspects of Newton method for finding zeros of mappings f: M_n -> R^n and vector fields X: M_x -> TM_n

entry.title: A generalized Numerov method for linear second-order differential equations involving a first derivative term
entry.summary: The Numerov method for linear second-order differential equations is generalized to include equations containing a first derivative term. The method presented has the same degree of accuracy as the ordinary Numerov sixth-order method. A general scheme of the application to the numerical solution of the Hartree-Fock equations is considered.

entry.title: Runge-Kutta methods, trees, and Mathematica
entry.summary: A simple and elementary proof of Butcher's theorem on the order conditions of Runge-Kutta methods is presented. It is based on a recursive definition of rooted trees and avoids combinatorial tools such as labelings and Faa di Bruno's formula. This strictly recursive approach can easily and elegantly be implemented using modern computer algrebra systems like Mathematica. The full but short source code is included and applied to some instructive examples.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, source files include a Mathematica notebook

entry.title: Multi-dimensional properties of One-dimensional discrete Fourier transform
entry.summary: A mathematical relation between elements of one- and multi-dimensional discrete Fourier transforms (DFT) is found. A method of analysing the multi-dimensional data by their single one-dimensional (1-D) DFT is offered. An experiment of filtering a two-dimensional image using the single 1-D DFT is carried out.

entry.title: On a new notion of regularizer
entry.summary: A new understanding of the notion of regularizer is proposed. It is argued that this new notion is more realistic than the old one and better fits the practical computational needs. An example of the regularizer in the new sense is given. A method for constructing regularizers in the new sense is proposed and justified.

entry.title: Optimal with respect to accuracy algorithms for calculation of multidimensional weakly singular integrals and applications to calculation of capacitances of conductors of arbitrary shapes
entry.summary: Cubature formulas, asymptotically optimal with respect to accuracy, are derived for calculating multidimensional weakly singular integrals. They are used for developing a universal code for calculating capacitances of conductors of arbitrary shapes.

entry.title: Continuous modified Newton's-type method for nonlinear operator equations
entry.summary: A nonlinear operator equation $F(x)=0$, $F:H\to H,$ in a Hilbert space is considered. Continuous Newton's-type procedures based on a construction of a dynamical system with the trajectory starting at some initial point $x_0$ and becoming asymptotically close to a solution of $F(x)=0$ as $t\to +\infty$ are discussed. Well-posed and ill-posed problems are investigated.

entry.title: Computational modeling of microstructure
entry.summary: Many materials such as martensitic or ferromagnetic crystals are observed to be in metastable states exhibiting a fine-scale, structured spatial oscillation called microstructure; and hysteresis is observed as the temperature, boundary forces, or external magnetic field changes. We have developed a numerical analysis of microstructure and used this theory to construct numerical methods that have been used to compute approximations to the deformation of crystals with microstructure.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 707--716

entry.title: A Generalised Trapezoid Type Inequality for Convex Functions
entry.summary: A generalised trapezoid inequality for convex functions and applications for quadrature rules are given. A refinement and a counterpart result for the Hermite-Hadamard inequalities are obtained and some inequalities for pdf's and (HH)-divergence measure are also mentioned.

entry.title: An Ostrowski Type Inequality for Convex Functions
entry.summary: An Ostrowski type integral inequality for convex functions and applications for quadrature rules and integral means are given. A refinement and a counterpart result for Hermite-Hadamard inequalities are obtained and some inequalities for pdf's and (HH)-divergence measure are also mentioned.

entry.title: Quintic Spline Solutions of Fourth Order Boundary-Value Problems
entry.summary: In this paper Quintic Spline is defined for the numerical solutions of the fourth order linear special case Boundary Value Problems. End conditions are also derived to complete the definition of spline.The algorithm developed approximates the solutions, and their higher order derivatives of differential equations. Numerical illustrations are tabulated to demonstrate the practical usefulness of method.

entry.title: Mean convergence of orthogonal Fourier series and interpolating polynomials
entry.summary: For a family of weight functions that include the general Jacobi weight functions as special cases, exact condition for the convergence of the Fourier orthogonal series in the weighted $L^p$ space is given. The result is then used to establish a Marcinkiewicz-Zygmund type inequality and to study weighted mean convergence of various interpolating polynomials based on the zeros of the corresponding orthogonal polynomials.

entry.title: Using Wavelets Based on B-splines for Calculation of the Hankel Transform
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to represent the integral Hankel transform as a series. If one uses B-spline wavelet this series is a linear combination of the hypergeometrical functions. Numerical evaluation of the test function with known analytical Hankel transform of the null kind illustrates the proposed results.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: WSEAS Trans. on Mathematics. 2004. V. 3. Iss. 1. pp. 250-252.

entry.title: Normal Systems of Algebraic and Partial Differential Equations
entry.summary: Here the polynomial interpolation approach is used to introduce the main results on multivariate normal algebraic systems. Next we bring a construction which shows that any standard algebraic system, with finite set of solutions, can be reduced to a normal type (total degree) algebraic system.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: International Conference on Constructive Function Theory, Abstracts, 2002, Varna, Bulgaria

entry.title: On interpolation by radial polynomials
entry.summary: A lemma of Micchelli's, concerning radial polynomials and weighted sums of point evaluations, is shown to hold for arbitrary linear functionals, as is Schaback's more recent extension of this lemma and Schaback's result concerning interpolation by radial polynomials. Schaback's interpolant is explored.

entry.title: Modified Rayleigh Conjecture for scattering by periodic structures
entry.summary: This paper contains a self-contained brief presentation of the scattering theory for periodic structures. Its main result is a theorem (the Modified Rayleigh Conjecture, or MRC), which gives a rigorous foundation for a numerical method for solving the direct scattering problem for periodic structures. A numerical example illustrating the procedure is presented.

entry.title: Differentiation matrices for meromorphic functions
entry.summary: A procedure to obtain differentiation matrices is extended straightforwardly to yield new differentiation matrices useful to obtain derivatives of complex rational functions. Such matrices can be used to obtain numerical solutions of some singular differential problems defined in the complex domain. The potential use of these matrices is illustrated with the case of elliptic functions.

entry.title: Adapting the time-step to recover the asymptotic behavior in a blow-up problem
entry.summary: The equation $u_t = \Delta u + u^p$ with homegeneous Dirichlet boundary conditions has solutions with blow-up if $p > 1$. An adaptive time-step procedure is given to reproduce the asymptotic behvior of the solutions in the numerical approximations. We prove that the numerical method reproduces the blow-up cases, the blow-up rate and the blow-up time. We also localize the numerical blow-up set.

entry.title: Optimal with respect to accuracy algorithms for calculation of multidimensional weakly singular integrals and applications to calculations of capacitances of conductors of arbitrary shapes
entry.summary: Cubature formulas, asymptotically optimal with respect to accuracy, are derived for calculating multidimensional weakly singular integrals. They are used for developing a universal code for calculating capacitances of conductors of arbitrary shapes.

entry.title: Set of Uniform Convergence for the Last Intermediate Row
entry.summary: Let a(z) be a meromorphic function having in the disk |z|<R precisely \lambda poles. In this work for the (\lambda-1)th row of the Pad\'e table of a(z) the set of uniform convergence is explicitly obtained. The present note is a supplement to the previous work of the author (J. Approx. Theory, 123(2003), 160-207).

entry.title: Not all limit points of poles of the Pad√© approximants are obstructions for poinwise convergence
entry.summary: In the work it is shown that not all limit points of poles of the Pad\'e approximants for the last intermediate row are obstructions for poinwise convergence of the whole row to an approximable function. The corresponding examples are constructed.

entry.title: A new construction of perfectly matched layers for the linearized Euler equations
